On Windows.

to a subdirectory, but there's something missing
like what is expanded, or what is selected, or what is moved...

Dave,
This one looks very similar to 68486. Could you please take a look at it too?
For both bugs, I would not consider it as major as I could not reproduce it 
until now.
Thanks

Ok, I've added some more isDisposed checks in the async display calls, I don't
have linux so could you hammer on these pages to see if it still happens.

Thanks
